block.p: Dr. Emily Jean Davidson, a daughter of Annette and George A. Davidson of New York, was married yesterday to Benjamin Ishak Resner, the son of the late Elizabeth Resner and the late Dr. Gerald Resner, both of whom lived in Berkeley, Calif. Judge Richard J. Talbot of Keene (N.H.) District Court performed the ceremony at the bride's parents' house in Spofford, N.H. The bridegroom's stepfather, Dr. Bennett Dubiner, was the best man.

Dr. Davidson, 32, is keeping her name. She is a fellow in developmental and behavioral pediatrics at Boston Children's Hospital. She graduated cum laude from Harvard University and received her medical degree from Yale. Her father is the chairman of the litigation department at Hughes Hubbard & Reed, a law firm in New York.

Dr. Emily Jean Davidson, a daughter of Annette and George A. Davidson of New York, was married yesterday to Benjamin Ishak Resner, the son of the late Elizabeth Resner and the late Dr. Gerald Resner, both of whom lived in Berkeley, Calif. Judge Richard J. Talbot of Keene (N.H.) District Court performed the ceremony at the bride's parents' house in Spofford, N.H. The bridegroom's stepfather, Dr. Bennett Dubiner, was the best man.

Dr. Davidson, 32, is keeping her name. She is a fellow in developmental and behavioral pediatrics at Boston Children's Hospital. She graduated cum laude from Harvard University and received her medical degree from Yale. Her father is the chairman of the litigation department at Hughes Hubbard & Reed, a law firm in New York.

Mr. Resner, 32, is a candidate for a master's degree in media arts and sciences at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology. He graduated from Cornell University. His father was a fellow in the psychiatry department of the University of California at San Francisco. His mother was the executive director of the Travelers Aid Society in San Francisco and the chairwoman of the Berkeley Mental Health Commission. The bridegroom's stepfather is a dentist in Berkeley.
